intro: Octarrhena myosurus, commonly known as the African mouse ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. The plant is also known for its medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
